result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Darnell Rayford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution set at zero.

No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of ilegal drugs/alcohol.
No violent contact with the victim named in the complaint.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 7 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1 & 2 and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No violent contact with the victim named in the complaint.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  As to Counts 1 & 2:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.19(1) and 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Add Count 2- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 947.01(1) and 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 06/29/2015 at 9:00am.  State rescinded their offer.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial date. State rescinds offer. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM004640  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-31-2015

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in custody.  Deann Heard for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Nicholas Kropp-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JASON R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Larry Darnell Rayford in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
